alert.note: Alert for Door (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 10:57AM CST until February 11 at 6:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW EXPECTED TO RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS TONIGHT... .A fast moving storm system will sweep across the region tonight. Snow from the storm will begin in central and north-central Wisconsin toward evening, and then quickly spread east across the rest of the region. The snow could fall quite heavily for a couple hours during the evening, then will diminish to light snow and drizzle or freezing drizzle after midnight. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. Winds gusting to around 30 mph will produce some blowing and drifting of the snow. * WHERE...Door County. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
